source_sentence: 香王菩薩陀羅尼呪經一卷
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Gandharva Bodhisattva One Fascicle
Translated by the Tripiṭaka Master Samanta Yijing

source_sentence: 南謨曷喇怛娜怛喇夜(引)也(一)南謨阿離耶跋盧吉羝說囉(引)也(二)菩提薩埵(引)也(三)莫訶薩埵(引)也(四)南謨健陀(引)羅曷囉社(引)也(五)菩提薩埵(引)也(六)莫訶薩埵(引)也(七)伊只[打-丁+致](八)彌只[打-丁+致](九)漢底(丁里反十)曼底(十一)薩婆頞他(上十二)娑(引)彈儞(十三)迦利沙般拏(引十四)地鉢謎(引十五)鉢唎拽叱(十六)莎(引)訶(十七)此陀羅尼先。
translation: 南謨曷喇怛娜怛喇夜(引)也(一)南謨阿離耶跋盧吉羝說囉(引)也(二)菩提薩埵(引)也(三)莫訶薩埵(引)也(四)南謨健陀(引)羅曷囉社(引)也(五)菩提薩埵(引)也(六)莫訶薩埵(引)也(七)伊只[打-丁+致](八)彌只[打-丁+致](九)漢底(丁里反十)曼底(十一)薩婆頞他(上十二)娑(引)彈儞(十三)迦利沙般拏(引十四)地鉢謎(引十五)鉢唎拽叱(十六)莎(引)訶(十七)此陀羅尼先。
You must wholeheartedly recite it 100,000 times.
He then places it in front of the Avalokitêśvara image.
He makes a four-pronged altar.
He'll gather flowers and other name-dropping incense for an offering.
At night, he uses a pure ox-headed sūran lamp.
Don't let the light be cut off.
At midnight, the master of the spell must rise.
He should wear clean clothing and be well-dressed.

source_sentence: 像前誦此陀羅尼一千八遍。
translation: He recites this dhāraṇī 1,800 times in front of his image.
At dawn, he must finish it and not fall asleep.

source_sentence: 其日呪師自有人送錢財等物。
translation: On that day, the maker of the spell will have money, property, and other items sent to him.
Whatever else important thing he seeks, he must draw a picture of the king of incense bodhisattva on silk.

source_sentence: 須畫香王菩薩於絹帛上其畫匠不得過中食。
translation: He must paint the fragrant king bodhisattva on silk, and the maker of the painting must not eat past midday.
He must observe the eight precepts.
He may paint an image of himself in any size.

source_sentence: 身肉皆白面貌端正頭戴天冠頸有瓔珞。
translation: His flesh is white, his face is straight, and he wears a crown of heavenly flesh around his neck and has a necklace.

source_sentence: 右臂垂下五指皆申施無畏手。
translation: His right arm hangs down, and his five fingers are splayed out in a fearless hand.

source_sentence: 其五指端各雨甘露施於五道眾生。
translation: At the end of each of their five fingers, they rain sweet dew to give to sentient beings in the five destinies.
Beneath his hand are three or five black demons painted on his head.
With his left arm bent at the elbow, he holds his hand to his left mother.
He takes a lotus flower in his hand.

source_sentence: 其花從脚下蓮華生出其花白紅色。
translation: From the lotus flower beneath his feet, a white-red flower emerges.
The lotus flower beneath his feet is also white-red in color.
The back of his head is perfectly shining.
There's an umbrella on top.
Five-colored brocade was used as his robe.
Two layers of beads are wrapped around his shoulder blades.
One is red, and the other yellow.
The image must be made on the same day.
No leather or glue should be used.

source_sentence: 像前燒香誦十萬遍一日一夜不食。
translation: Burn incense and recite 100,000 recitations in front of the image for a day and a night without food.
First, a large water altar must be made and finished.
Then, he must polish it with sandalwood.
It's made into eight small 12-finger altars.
The first three altars are for worshiping the Buddha.
One is for making offerings to the Buddha.
One is for making offerings to the Dharma.
One is for making offerings to the saṃgha.
The fourth altar is dedicated to Amitâbha Buddha.
The fifth is dedicated to Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva.
The sixth is an offering to Mahāsthāmaprāpta Bodhisattva.
The seventh is an offering to the Fragrance King Bodhisattva.
The eighth offering is to the good spirits and so forth.
They all take good, pure food, fruit, and flowers.
They place them on all sides.

source_sentence: 其法隨以何月十四十五日作。
translation: They do so according to the fourteenth day of the month.

source_sentence: 然取闍帝花(此云荳蔻華)一千八莖。
translation: Then, take 1,008 stalks of the jhadi flower (here called cardamom blossoms).
He recites it once and tosses it onto the image's chest.
After the ritual is performed, he must get up at midnight every night.
You should always recite it 1,800 times in front of the image.
That's when someone sends money and property on their own.

source_sentence: 其錢財亦不得積聚慳貪。
translation: Their money and property shouldn't be accumulated in stinginess and greediness.
He must then spend it and give it to the poor.
This is the Dharma of the incense king bodhisattva.
"Furthermore, there's a special practice that's essential and abbreviated.
This is the method of holding a mantra.
The practitioner washes and bathes himself, puts on fresh, clean clothing, and observes the eight precepts.
He takes the eight precepts and observes their observance.
He forms a pure altar in the same way as the precepts.

source_sentence: 依次第而布供養散花燒香然燈。
translation: In order, he spreads offerings, scatters flowers, and burns incense and a lamp.
From midnight, he rises.
He sits cross-legged on the altar.

source_sentence: 誦呪一千八遍須瞻蔔花一千八莖。
translation: He recites the dhāraṇī 1,800 times and throws 1,800 stalks of flowers at them.
Once he recites the dhāraṇī, he throws a stalk of flowers at it.
Put it on the body of the bodhisattva.
While reciting the dhāraṇī, he doesn't need to hear the sound of birds singing.
There's no need to hear the sound of birds chirping.
He relieves himself with the three white foods and makes offerings.
He burns incense for repose and makes offerings.
Each day, he washes his body with filtered water and fragrant bath.
He wears separate robes.
Both large and small walkers must wash themselves.

source_sentence: 平旦夜半入壇之時並須嚼楊枝。
translation: On New Year's Day at midnight, when he enters the altar, he must chew the poplar branch.
Then, he enters the altar and wholeheartedly recites the mantra.

source_sentence: 莫思量外事即見神驗光明。
translation: Don't think about external matters, and then you'll see the brightness of divine experience.
He'll then rest when he sees the test.
When he doesn't see the light, there's still movement.
Where he practices, he'll greatly reap the rewards.
You mustn't break the precepts by keeping the mantra.

source_sentence: 身亦不得近觸著女人觸著女人者即無驗。
translation: He also mustn't touch a woman near his body. Touching a woman means there's no validation.
Incense King Dhāraṇī Sutra of the Bodhisattva
